items.headline: Business investment perks up from tax cuts and AI spending to help offset tariff troubles
items.summary_en: The industrial side of the U.S. economy has been rocked by higher tariffs, but a saving grace has been new tax cuts for investment and a frenzy of spending in artificial intelligence. Business investment rose sharply in August to mark the second strong increase in a row.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I plan to retire in 10 years’: I inherited $600,000 in Apple shares. Am I crazy if I don’t sell them now?
items.summary_en: “Apple now makes up about 50% of my portfolio.”

items.headline: I’m 70 and have Alzheimer’s. My son’s girlfriend put $750 worth of lottery tickets on a credit card I gave him. What can I do?
items.summary_en: “I contacted the credit-card company, but was advised they could not reimburse me for the theft.”

items.headline: Starbucks is cutting more jobs and closing stores as part of a $1 billion restructuring
items.summary_en: Starbucks the job cuts will be in non-retail positions, and many open positions will be closed.

items.headline: Why Big Tech’s tiny production costs make it a long term winner, says this fund manager
items.summary_en: AOT Growth and Innovation ETF portfolio manager, John Tinsman says there’s one clear reason to invest in big tech companies: low marginal cost.

items.summary_en: The path for interest rates looks like it’s heading down, but that’s far from a sure thing.

items.headline: I’m about to inherit a lot of money. How do I make sure my husband doesn’t get any of it?
items.summary_en: “We want to invest the money and play catch up with our retirement savings/funding.”

items.summary_en: Claims have been volatile in recent weeks.

items.headline: Nvidia’s stock can soar 35% more, Barclays says. Why AI spending estimates now seem less ‘outlandish.’
items.summary_en: The wave of AI data-center announcements in recent months has Barclays analysts feeling more positive about Nvidia and other AI chip names as they see the AI infrastructure market reaching $2 trillion and beyond.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: U.S. trade deficit sinks to 2-year low as businesses try to time orders to beat tariff price hikes
items.summary_en: The nation’s trade deficit in goods sank 17% in August to a two-year low, extending a run of big ups and downs as business try to time imports and exports to pay the least amount of tariffs.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.
